snippet: The Oakland Raiders fired Coach Hue Jackson in the first major move since Reggie McKenzie was hired as the general manager.
abstract: NFL Roundup; Oakland Raiders fire coach Hue Jackson after one season at the helm in the first major move since Reggie McKenzie was hired as general manager; move marks rapid fall for Jackson, who took charge of personnel decisions as well as coaching after the death of longtime owner Al Davis; Raiders lost four of their last five games to mark their ninth straight season without a winning record or playoff berth; other NFL news noted.
lead_paragraph: The Oakland Raiders fired Coach Hue Jackson in the first major move since Reggie McKenzie was hired as the general manager.

headline.main: In Raiders’ Power Shift, Jackson Is Out as Coach
headline.print_headline: Raiders’ Slide Costs Jackson Job as Coach
